advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> ACE 1000 ADVERT (1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ACORN AD. #3 (NOV. 86)</strong></font><br><blockquote>Advert said:<br><br><font color="#666666"> The BBC Master Compact's educational software, takes children from their first grasp of words and numbers to A-level and beyond.<br> In 84% of U.K. schools, children are already growing up with BBC micros.<br> With a BBC Master Compact at home, your child's ability with computers will progress in leaps and bounds... </font></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>advert said:<br><br> No waiting for software<font color="#666666"> ...This exciting micro has fired the imagination of programmers who are busy developping new software to take full advantage of its performance capabilities...</font><br><br> No wait state<font color="#666666"> ...One advantage is the total elimination of memory access wait states so that interaction between the processor, RAM and disk drive is speeded up...</font><br><br> A free p-System for those who don't wait <font color="#666666"> ...A free p-System operating system and PASCAL, FORTRAN 77 and BASIC compilers which alone lists for $1475, we're now including free with the Sage II...</font> </blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMMERCIAL PAMPHLET - PAGE #4</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">thanks to Richard Rogers </p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD (MAY 1984)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. AD. (1983) #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>advert said:<br><br><font color="#666666"> Our all-in-one BMC IF-800 computer is easier for dealers to sell, customers to buy and OEM to use in their systems...<br> ... You can upgrade to a 16 bit CPU which offers IBM PC compatible MS-DOS and CP/M-86...</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD (MAY 1984)</strong></font><br><blockquote>A selection for the Initiator... at Sinclair price</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD (DEC. 1986)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> JAPANESE ADVERT.</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Picture courtesy of Junya Kubota </p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (FEBRUARY 1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT (1983)</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Gerard Touitou</b></p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ORIGINAL ARTICLE</strong></font><br><blockquote>The history of the Galaksija started with a magazine article - called "Raèunara u vašoj kuæi" (computers in your home) by Dejan Ristanoviæ. This magazine was the first issue of the magazine series called later "Raèunara". This first issue included an article about the do-if-yourself computer "Galaksija" written by Voja Antonic. <br><br> <font color="#666666">Source : <a href="http://www.homecomputer.de/" target="_blank">HomeComputerMuseum.de</a></font></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> 1980 COLECO CATALOG</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://www.textfiles.com/digitize/items/" target="_blank">Digitize, Textfiles.com</a> for the picture</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>"Alice, a computer for all levels"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"The computing answer"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. AD. (1983)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> GERMAN ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>This is a German advertisement for the BIT-60 and BIT-90 models. Atari VCS-2600 cartridges are scattered in front of the BIT-60, to show that the BIT-60 is really compatible with the VCS-2600 ! But strangely enough, there is no picture displayed on the TV. Were these models really working ? ;-)</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ADVERT #6 (1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote>The new sale price is $99.95 instead of 149.95 <br><br> Advert said: <br><br> <font color="#666666">The ZX81 represents the latest technology in microelectronics. More than 10,000 are sold every week. In fact, the ZX81 is the best selling personal computer in the world.</font> </blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> UK ADVERT #1</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> NORTHSTAR BROCHURE #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>NorthStar brochure - Page 2 <b>EXPANSION OPTIONS</b><br><br> <b>HRAM.64</b> - High Speed 64Kb Dynamic RAM memory board with parity (up to a total of six)<br> <b>HSIO.4</b> - Four Serial Port Expansion Board (RS-232C or Current Loop).<br> <b>FPB</b> - Floating Point Arithmetic Board.<br> <b>ADC-2D</b> - Two additionaI 5 1/4 inch Double capacity floppy disk drives incorporated within a cabinet (360 Kb total capacity).<br> <b>ADC-2Q</b> - Two additionaI 5 1/4 inch Quad capacity floppy disk drives incorporated within a cabinet (720 Kb total capacity).<br> <b>HDS-5</b> - 5 1/4 inch Winchester Hard Disk 5 Mb formatted capacity.<br> <b>HDS-18</b> - 14 inch Winchester Hard Disk 18 Mb formatted capacity.<br> <b>Tape Backup</b> - 13.4 Mb Tape Backup system for HDS-18 or HDS-5.<br> <b>CRT</b> - Hazeltine 1420/Soroc 120. (Other software drivers available.)<br> <b>Printer</b> - 35 or 55 cps letter quality printer. <p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Gordon Dyer</b> from England </p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> STUPID PICTURE #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>The same women has changed its shirt... But hey, what's the message behind this pictures ? Would it be that it's sexy to work on an Alpha Plus, or that women prefer men owning an Alpha Plus ?!</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMMODORE WATCHES!</strong></font><br><blockquote>While manufacturing and selling calculators in 1977, Commodore sold wristwatches.<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Chuck Guzis</b></p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (FEBRUARY 1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> VC20 GERMAN ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to Christian Hart for this scan</p></blockquote>

computer.description:
TADEO CZERWENY "CZ" is a an electromechanical company, which was founded by Tadeo Czerweny in September 1958. It is located in Parana, Entre Rios province, in Argentina. The company made transformers, electric motors, etc. In the 80?s Czerweny marketed the Timex Sinclair?s models, under its own name.
The CZ-1000 is thus a rebadged Timex Sinclair 1000, which is itself a Sinclair ZX-81 with 2 KB RAM.
In Argentina Czerweny models competed with Brazilians TK 83, 85, 90x and genuine Sinclair machines, but CZ sold more machines than them.
_____________
Marcelo Garcia comments: In the 80's in Argentina it was possible to find a memory expansion module (16 KB), which was simply a box with extra memory chips which plugged into the back of the Czerweny CZ 1000

emulator.description: Excellent emulator emulating nearly all ZX computers (80, 81, Spectrums, Timex, etc.). As well as emulating the machines themselves, numerous addon cards are supported, including hi-res graphics, custom character sets, sound and colour cards.
emulator.name: EightyOne

emulator.description: Sinclair ZX81 Emulator (with Visual Basic sources). Excellent emulator
emulator.name: VB81

emulator.description: The best ZX emulator for PC compatibles
emulator.name: X-Tender

emulator.description: With this JAVA emulator, you'll be able to run a Timex/Sinclair 1000 in your browser window
emulator.name: Timex/Sinclair 1000 Emulator (Java)

emulator.description: ZX-81 Emulator for the SonyEricsson P800 Smart Phone
emulator.name: zx81emu

emulator.description: MESS emulates the ZX-81, Lambda 8300, Power 3000 and other clones !
emulator.name: MESS
